item.title: PI triple requirement?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Sir Jay, post:2, topic:374758”]Why if (c.combatLevel >= 50 && c.combatLevel >=90 && c.isDonator = true) You are basically saying if combat level is more than or equal to 50, AND if your combat level is more than or equal to 90? Why not just > 50 and < 100?

Assuming you have all of your variables declared:

if (c.combatLevel > 50 && c.combatLevel < 100 && c.isDonator = true) { // body } [/quote]
was thinking about that one, but it still says a variable is expected, not a value, but for the level requirement now, not the donator requirement

Read full topic

Assuming you have all of your variables declared:

if (c.combatLevel > 50 && c.combatLevel < 100 && c.isDonator == true) {
 //  body
}

item.title: PI triple requirement?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

now i want to make 3 requirements, for slayer in specific, to get a task, you need a certain combat level (between too, so its

if (c.combatLevel >= 50 && c.combatLevel >=90)
but i want it as a triple requirement, like

if (c.combatLevel >= 50 && c.combatLevel >=90 && c.isDonator = true)

however when i do this, it expects a variable not a value and gives me an error
Does anyone have a solution to this?

Read full topic
